alert.note: Alert for Gallatin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 3:12AM MDT until June 22 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Montana... Gallatin River at Logan affecting Gallatin County. For the Gallatin River...including DCP-Gallatin R/Gateway, Logan... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Gallatin River at Logan. * WHEN...From this morning to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.8 feet, Water may be on small bridges and around railroad bridge footing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM MDT Monday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 600 PM MDT.
